Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I gained insight into the general laziness and lack of commitment that permeates the behavior of a significant portion of the students who take this class. Because of this, rehearsals throughout the semester were repetitive, dull and frustrating; coachings were full of advice as to how to play what was already on the page, rather than how to build the collaborative skills and interpretive artistry that I previously thought were essential to chamber music.

I learned a lot about playing chamber music from 4 excellent coaches over the course of the year.  I also learned how to work with my fellow musicians and deal with people who can be difficult with scheduling or have a negative attitude about the course.
chamber music
I have grown as a musician every semester taking this course-- every chamber group and piece teaches you to be a more flexible and nuanced player.
Chamber music. Take the class.
Playing with a group better
Amazing class that develops skills in playing chamber music, and also working together and advising others.
So much: the coaches for this class are truly excellent, and every coaching offers me new kernels about how to be a great musician.

Wendy Sharp's chamber music seminar was one of the highlights of my freshman year at Yale. The class is structured well so that there is time to rehearse individually, rehearse with qualified coaches and perform for peers. The class deepened my love for music, introduced me to new pieces and strengthened my chamber music skills.
Developed chamber music playing skills!
Improved as a chamber player!
Final concerts were a bit too long this year. Consistency in performance class length would be helpful in planning ahead and juggling busy schedules.

I generally gained very, very little from other groups' playing in the masterclasses. The issues with each group's playing were obvious and had far more to do with lack of adequate preparation than interpretive direction (with some exceptions), and there was therefore little to gain for those who were NOT playing. Of course, performance experience is critical; however, I suggest that perhaps some sort of organized community performance as a "midterm," in conjunction with a mock jury or two and an end-of-semester concert, would be a far better use of everyone's time. I find that masterclasses in general are ineffective unless significant time is devoted to each player/group (45 minutes to an hour at least). This aspect of the class needs MAJOR restructuring if it is to become efficient and productive. Coachings and rehearsal format were generally good; however, there needs to be some sort of rehearsal enforcement mechanism, as this was a serious problem in my group. Standards NEED to be set higher.

The coaches were excellent, and I liked the format of studio classes.  However, studio class would often go quite a bit over time (which often left me little to no time to eat dinner afterward).  I also do not think I was well-matched with other musicians in terms of level and commitment to the course - it was sometimes difficult to try to organize and run rehearsals when only one other group member contributed.
n/a
This is a great course for anyone interested in playing chamber music. The coaches are excellent and the other students give helpful feedback in studio classes.
It is amazing, but I wish we could coordinate more coachings
I loved every rehearsal, pieces, and coaching. I just wish that studio classes weren't so long or happening all at once. Especially the concert at the end.

This class has a great structure, with time with coaches, in rehearsal, and time together to hear other groups and comment on others' performances. Wendy is always incredibly organized so all the parts run smoothly.
The only weakness of the course is that the studio classes sometimes ran over. Other than that this is a wonderful class!
Such a great course! The format is perfect, I really enjoyed it!

Great course for working w/ great people and learning a new piece! 

Weaknesses: Sometimes certain members of the group are less prepared than others, it's hard to sometimes make appointments with the resident quartet.
Yes! This class was a lot of fun.

I would ABSOLUTELY NOT recommend this course to another student unless they can previously guarantee that the group in which they will be placed is one of standards, level of dedication and collaborative atmosphere equal to theirs (read: your chamber mates are nice, competent people who you can get along with). I have no doubt that my experience  would have been generally positive if this had worked out; however, my group was seemingly randomly assigned and the conflicts this generated basically defined my experience with the class. The masterclass format wastes a large amount of time, as the time allotment for each group is too short to be meaningful and the large majority of groups are unprepared. I became quite frustrated and disaffected by the attitude of my peers and doubt that I will ever be taking this course again.
Playing chamber music with friends! Excellent coaches, great music, what more could you ask for?
I would recommend this course to someone who loves chamber music and is ready to commit to a group.
Yes if you want to play chamber music
Yes, definitely.
Yes!!!! take it if you enjoy chamber music at a high level!
This class is a joy. If you want to take part in chamber music at Yale, this is the way to do it.
I would very highly recommend this course to another student -- chamber music is always fun, and to do it in such a supportive and stimulating environment is really rewarding.
Absolutely!
This is an amazing class, and I would strongly recommend it to others.
Great and fun chamber music class!
Absolutely! I would love to be a  Music 220/221 ambassador if I could. This class adds so much to my weeks and I always look forward to it.
Absolutely! Chamber has been one of the highlights of my year, and I'm very glad to have taken this class.
Yes!! Wonderful class for any musician with a strong background in performance and chamber music.
If you want to play serious chamber music and are willing to put in the rehearsal time, absolutely take it! All of the musicians in this course are outstanding players, and you will grow a lot.
I'd recommend the course if you want to play a chamber piece. You're not going to find a higher level of chamber music playing as an undergrad at Yale.
